title: News | Middlebury News and Announcements
text:
Faculty and Staff Authors Honored
The annual reception recognized 17 authors for works covering a wide range of academic disciplines.
1383 Items
The annual reception recognized 17 authors for works covering a wide range of academic disciplines.
The country’s oldest academic honor society welcomed the new members during a ceremony on Commencement weekend.
580 students earned their degrees at the College’s 224th Commencement.
A medical student at Stanford School of Medicine, Nguyen is among 84 scholars selected representing 25 countries.
Trustees endorsed a $344 million budget, amended the core retirement plan, and reaffirmed their commitment to institutional autonomy and board independence.
The grants provide financial support for undergraduate research projects in the humanities.
Middlebury received a total of 11,831 applications for the Class of 2029 and 2029.5 with a record high number of international students in the pool. Acceptances were sent to 13.9 percent of the applicant pool.
Davis, a Vermont native, will join philanthropist Marna Olsen Davis, author Heather McGhee, and artist Dario Robleto in receiving honorary degrees at the May 25 ceremony.
The annual award promotes cultural interchange and good will between Scotland and the United States.
Four other recent graduates and one current student received honorable mention.
